alert.note: Alert for Inland Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 2:09PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cameron County through 245 PM CDT... At 209 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Brownsville Sports Park, or over Olmito, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... San Benito, Los Fresnos, Rancho Viejo, Rio Hondo, La Paloma, Cameron Park, Laureles, Olmito, Brownsville, and La Encantada Elementary School. This includes the following highways... Interstate Highway 69 E between mile markers 5 and 22. US Highway 281 between mile markers 826 and 836. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
